title: Zatch Bell
author: Makoto Rayku
description: Fourteen-year-old Kiyo, an arrogant genius who is teased mercilessly at school, is given a strange boy, Zatch Bell, for his birthday to help him make friends. But Zatch isn't exactly a normal kid—he's a mamodo child from another world with magical powers.

title: Zatch Bell
author: Makoto Rayku
description: The battle for the mamodo crown continues as Zatch and Kiyo face new challenges and powerful opponents in their quest to become the king of the mamodo world.

title: Zatch Bell
author: Makoto Rayku
description: Kiyo and Zatch continue their battle against other mamodo and their human partners, discovering new spells and strengthening their bond of friendship.

title: Neon Genesis Evangelion
author: Yoshiyuki Sadamoto
description: The 3-in-1 edition combines volumes 1-3. Once Shinji didn't care about anything; then he found people to fight for—only to learn that he couldn't protect them, or keep those he let into his heart from going away. As mankind tilts on the brink of the apocalyptic Third Impact, Shinji must face the darkness within himself.

title: Neon Genesis Evangelion
author: Yoshiyuki Sadamoto
description: The landmark manga series continues its intense psychological drama as Shinji and the other Eva pilots face increasingly complex challenges and revelations about the true nature of the Evangelions and the Angels.

title: 21st Century Boys
author: Naoki Urasawa
cover_image: following the conclusion of the Friend's story and revealing the final mysteries that remained unsolved.

title: 20th Century Boys
author: Naoki Urasawa
description: A deluxe bind-up edition of Naoki Urasawa's award-winning epic of doomsday cults, giant robots and a group of friends trying to save the world from destruction! Humanity, having faced extinction at the end of the 20th century, would not have entered the new millennium if it weren't for them.

title: 20th Century Boys
author: Naoki Urasawa
description: The mystery deepens as Kenji and his friends continue their investigation into the Friend and the deadly prophecy that seems to be coming true.

title: Monster Volume 1
author: Naoki Urasawa
description: Naoki Urasawa's unforgettable thriller follows a brilliant doctor's journey into the darkest depths of the human soul. Johan is a cold and calculating killer with a mysterious past, and brilliant Dr. Kenzo Tenma is the only one who can stop him! Conspiracy and serial murder open the door to a compelling, intricately woven plot.

title: Batmanga  By Jiro Kuwata
author: OVNI
year: The classic manga available in English in its entirety for the first time! These are the Batman stories originally published in Japan in 1966-1967
description: featuring the Dynamic Duo facing off against classic villains in Japanese manga style.
